channel.title: Need Help to Port Forward
channel.description:
Hi
I need help Port Forwarding with a SKY Sagem Router that I use wirelessly on a laptop. I dont know what to put in these Inbound/Outbound Boxes for my Firewall Settings. It comes up with something like this:
[b]FIREWALL RULES - OUTBOUND SERVICES
Filter Name: Service: Action - Block ALWAYS Block By Schedule Allow ALWAYS Allow By Schedule LAN Users - Any Single Address Address Range Start: 4 boxes Netmask: 4 boxes WAN Users - Any Single Address Address Range Start: 4 boxes Netmask: 4 boxes
FIREWALL RULES - INBOUND SERVICES
Filter Name: Service: Action - Allow ALWAYS Allow By Schedule Block ALWAYS Block By Schedule Send to LAN server: 4 boxes WAN Users - Any Single Address Address Range Start: 4 boxes Netmask: 4 boxes[/b]
I am willing to give Co Owner of my server and Admin on my Servers website. If you can help please do feel free to ask for my Email Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help to Port Forward
item.dc:creator: @Beastly1 Beastly¿
item.description:
@Beastly1 wrote:

Okay. So your connecting to a router…

First,

Start > Run >

Type in Command Prompt

It should open Command Prompt.

Now type in ipconfig.

If you get this:

'ipconfig' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program, or batch file.

Then:

Start > Search

Type in Command Prompt

It should show up your results with Command Prompt…DON’T CLICK ON IT YET.

Right click on it, and run as an administrator.

Enter your Administrator Password…

Then type in ipconfig.

You should get some results.

Try to look for your Default Gateway.

Once you have located it, open up your Internet Browser, and type in your Default Gateway into your Address.

Once you do, just add the Port* for your server.

Hope this helped.

    • I just said that because I do not know the contents of your router.

Read full topic

@iX_Jaz_Xi wrote:

Hi

I need help Port Forwarding with a SKY Sagem Router that I use wirelessly on a laptop.
I dont know what to put in these Inbound/Outbound Boxes for my Firewall Settings.
It comes up with something like this:

[b]FIREWALL RULES - OUTBOUND SERVICES

Filter Name:
Service:
Action - Block ALWAYS
Block By Schedule

LAN Users - Any
Single Address

Netmask: 4 boxes
